result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Mardon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant.

BTC: GUILTY. CT 2 is dismissed but read in.

74 days RCJ; 74 days credit for time served.

Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, reduced to judgement. 

BTC: Case 21CT782 is dismissed and read in. Case 21TR011291 is dismissed and read in.

Defense is asking that defendant is released from custody and provides arguments as to why. Seeking to be appointed as attorney on record on defendant's other case. Looking to resolve today.
State indicates defendant is not being held on a warrant from this court as the defendant has a signature bond. Puts offer on the record.  
BTC: Matter set over to a COP for this afternoon.
